intro: Boechera pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf rockcress, is a small, flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Boechera pygmaea is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in areas with poor soil and high sunlight exposure.
